meanings.definition: The quality or state of being grimy.
meanings.sent1: The griminess of the old car made it look very dirty.
meanings.sent2: I cleaned the kitchen to get rid of the griminess on the countertops.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the griminess of the mud on their shoes.
meanings.sent4: The griminess of the city streets reflected the neglect of the area.
meanings.sent5: The griminess of the abandoned house gave it a spooky feel.

meanings.definition: The presence of dirt or filth.
meanings.sent1: She scrubbed the floor to remove the griminess left by the muddy footprints.
meanings.sent2: The griminess on the windows made it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat's paws left a trail of griminess across the freshly mopped floor.
meanings.sent4: The griminess in the alley attracted rats looking for food.
meanings.sent5: The griminess of the public restroom was a major turn-off for customers.
